content:
# FACTORIO AGENT REPORT

## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Power Generation System at Position(-9.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at position(-9.5, -0.5) - working
- Boiler at position(-5.0, 2.5) - now has coal but shows "out of fuel" warning
- Steam engine at position(0.5, 6.5) - working
- Pipe network connecting these components
- Small electric pole at position(0.5, 8.5) connected to the steam engine

### Iron Ore Mining Operation at Position(19.5, 71.5)
Consists of:
- Electric mining drill 1 at position(16.5, 71.5) - waiting for space in destination
- Electric mining drill 2 at position(19.5, 71.5) - working
- Electric mining drill 3 at position(22.5, 71.5) - working
- Small electric poles at positions(14.5, 70.5) and (24.5, 73.5) providing power
- Wooden chest at position(19.5, 73.5) collecting ore from drill 2 (currently full)
- Wooden chest at position(22.5, 73.5) collecting ore from drill 3
- Inserter at position(22.5, 74.5) to move ore from chest to belt (waiting for space)
- Multiple belt groups connecting the mining area to the furnaces

### Iron Plate Production Area at Position(25.5, 84.5)
Consists of:
- Electric furnace 1 at position(22.5, 84.5) - no ingredients
- Electric furnace 2 at position(25.5, 84.5) - no ingredients
- Electric furnace 3 at position(28.5, 84.5) - no ingredients
- Connected to the electricity network

### Steel Plate Production Area at Position(29.5, 95.5)
Consists of:
- Electric furnace 1 at position(26.5, 95.5) - not connected to power
- Electric furnace 2 at position(29.5, 95.5) - not connected to power
- Electric furnace 3 at position(32.5, 95.5) - not connected to power

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when connecting entities with belts
- When using `connect_entities()`, ensure there is a valid path between the start and end positions
- The error "Not a valid path to normalise" indicates the path is too complex or impossible to create
- Try creating shorter, simpler belt paths or use underground belts for longer distances

### Errors when placing entities in occupied spaces
- Check if a position is already occupied before placing an entity
- Use `get_entities()` to check for existing entities at a location before placing new ones
- Clear existing entities with `pickup()` before attempting to place new ones at the same position

### Errors with transport belt validation
- Multiple validation errors for TransportBelt indicate incorrect parameter formatting
- Ensure all required fields (name, direction, position, etc.) are properly specified when creating belts
- When placing belts programmatically, use the correct API parameters

### Mining efficiency issues
- "Transport belt at drop position is blocked" indicates that the output belt from mining drill is full or blocked
- "Chest at drop position is full" indicates the chest needs to be emptied
- Use inserters to move items from chests to belts to keep the production flowing

### Power connection issues
- Ensure all electrical entities are connected to the power network
- The steel furnaces show "not connected to power network" - extend the electric pole network to reach them

## NAMESPACE
No functions have been defined by the agent yet.
